question.title: What is the primary treatment for external haemorrhoidal thrombosis?
question.description: The treatment of external haemorrhoidal thrombosis involves both non-medicinal and medicinal approaches.

option_a.title: Surgical excision of the affected area
option_a.description: A surgical procedure to remove the thrombosed haemorrhoid

option_b.title: Cold compresses and sitz baths
option_b.description: A non-medicinal approach to reduce swelling and relieve pain

option_c.title: Antibiotic ointments
option_c.description: A medicinal approach to prevent infection

option_d.title: Hemorrhoidectomy with thrombolytic therapy
option_d.description: A surgical procedure to remove the thrombosed haemorrhoid and dissolve the clot
